v.v: For you ask, ‘What use is it to me?’
Look up at the sky, and see it;
If you have sinned, what harm do you do to God?
If you are righteous, what can you give to him?
Your wickedness may hurt a man, as you are a man,
Because of many acts of oppression, people cry out;
But no one says, ‘Where is God my Maker,
who teaches us more than he teaches the beasts of the earth,
There they cry out, but God gives no answer
God will certainly not hear a foolish cry;
How much less will he answer you if you say that you do not see him,
Now you say that his anger does not punish,
So Job opens his mouth only to speak foolishness;

v: when you say, ‘My right before God’?
and, ‘Would I be better off if I had sinned?’
see the sky, which is higher than you.
If your transgressions pile up high, what do you do to him?
What will he receive from your hand?
and your righteousness might benefit another son of man.
they call for help from the arms of mighty men.
who gives songs in the night,
and who makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?’
because of the pride of evil men.
the Almighty will pay no attention to it.
that your case is before him, and that you are waiting for him!
and he does not take even a litte notice of transgression.
he piles up words without knowledge.”
